objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the author and publisher of the report and associated YARA rules.

objects.name: WSqmCons registry value
objects.description: Used by Infinite Second to store the obfuscated PowerShell payload (Script C) for ComRAT deployment.

objects.name: WSqmConBin registry value
objects.description: Backup path to the Microsoft Consolidator executable maintained by Infinite Second to recreate the scheduled task.

objects.name: WSqmConHex registry value
objects.description: Optional backup of Microsoft Consolidator arguments created by Infinite Second.

objects.name: WSqmConBak registry value
objects.description: Backup of Microsoft Consolidator scheduled task configuration used by Infinite Second for persistence reinstallation.

objects.name: WINEVT ChannelReferences key
objects.description: Registry key under which Infinite Second stores 3DES parameters for the modified PowerSploit component (password and salt values N and S).

objects.name: N registry value
objects.description: Registry value used by Infinite Second to store the hardcoded 3DES password for decrypting the embedded PowerSploit content.

objects.name: S registry value
objects.description: Registry value used by Infinite Second to store the hardcoded 3DES salt for decrypting the embedded PowerSploit content.

objects.name: Modified Consolidator scheduled task file
objects.description: Infinite Second modifies this scheduled task definition to bootstrap its malicious PowerShell execution at logon and every 6 hours.
objects.pattern: [file:name = 'Consolidator' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE 'C:\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer Experience Improvement Program']

objects.name: tmp4071.tmp
objects.description: File deleted by Infinite Second installer; likely an artefact of a parent component.

objects.name: thumbs.ini
objects.description: PowerShell-like script executed and then deleted by Infinite Second during execution.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell dropper that deploys ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell dropper that deploys ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Infinite Second PowerShell script (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the Infinite Second PowerShell dropper that deploys ComRAT.

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (Base64 encoded) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the installer-stored, Base64-encoded payload saved under WSqmCons.

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (Base64 encoded) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the installer-stored, Base64-encoded payload saved under WSqmCons.

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (Base64 encoded) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the installer-stored, Base64-encoded payload saved under WSqmCons.

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (decoded) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the decoded main Infinite Second script (Script C) extracted from WSqmCons.

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (decoded) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the decoded main Infinite Second script (Script C) extracted from WSqmCons.

objects.name: Indicator for Script stored in registry (decoded) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the decoded main Infinite Second script (Script C) extracted from WSqmCons.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the modified PowerSploit script used by Infinite Second for in-memory DLL injection.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the modified PowerSploit script used by Infinite Second for in-memory DLL injection.

objects.name: Indicator for Modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the modified PowerSploit script used by Infinite Second for in-memory DLL injection.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload DLL (x86) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL dropped and executed in-memory by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload DLL (x86) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL dropped and executed in-memory by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload DLL (x86) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the 32-bit ComRAT DLL dropped and executed in-memory by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload DLL (x64) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL dropped and executed in-memory by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload DLL (x64) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL dropped and executed in-memory by Infinite Second.

objects.name: Indicator for ComRAT payload DLL (x64) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the 64-bit ComRAT DLL dropped and executed in-memory by Infinite Second.

objects.name: infinite second
objects.description: Infinite Second is a malicious PowerShell dropper that installs persistence and deploys a ComRAT (aka Chinch) DLL payload. It hijacks the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program's Consolidator scheduled task to bootstrap on user log-in and every 6 hours, stores configuration and obfuscated payloads in the Windows registry, and uses multiple layers of obfuscation (Base64, XOR, GZIP, and 3DES). It selects 32- or 64-bit payloads based on the target architecture and injects ComRAT into the explorer process using a modified PowerSploit Invoke-ReflectivePEInjection script.

objects.name: comrat
objects.description: ComRAT (also referred to as Chinch) is the RAT payload dropped and executed by Infinite Second. In this report, ComRAT is delivered as 32-bit or 64-bit DLLs that are deobfuscated (Base64 and GUNZIP) and injected into the explorer process via a modified PowerSploit reflective injection, potentially to avoid Windows Firewall interference.

objects.name: Microsoft
objects.description: Microsoft is the vendor of the legitimate components abused by the malware, including the Customer Experience Improvement Program's Consolidator scheduled task and wsqmcons.exe.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: PowerShell
objects.description: Infinite Second is a PowerShell script that deploys and set ups up persistence for ComRAT.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Infinite Second creates or modifies a scheduled task to run as SYSTEM to launch ComRAT.

objects.name: Modify Registry
objects.description: Infinite Second stores cryptographic keys, additional scripts and obfuscated payloads in the registry.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Infinite Second deobfuscates information stored in the registry using 3DES, XOR, and Base64 encoding.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: Infinite Second uses registry values that masquerade as legitimate software.

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: Infinite Second deletes C:\Windows\Temp\tmp4071.tmp and C:\Users\Public\Documents\thumbs.ini.

objects.name: infinitesecond_custom_xor
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_custom_xor
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the XOR implementation"

    strings:
      $a =
"KGJ5dGVbXSBpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXMsIGJ5dGVbXSBnYW1tYSl7Ynl0ZVtdIG91dHB1dCA9IG5l
dyBieXRlW2luY29tZV9ieXRlcy5MZW5ndGhdO2ZvciAoaW50IGkgPSAwOyBpIDwgaW5jb21lX
2J5dGVzLkxlbmd0aDsgKytpKXtvdXRwdXRbaV0gPSAoYnl0ZSkoaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzW2ldIF
4gZ2FtbWFbaSAlIGdhbW1hLkxlbmd0aF0pO31yZXR1cm4gb3V0cHV0O319"

$b =

"hieXRlW10gaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzLCBieXRlW10gZ2FtbWEpe2J5dGVbXSBvdXRwdXQgPSBuZX
cgYnl0ZVtpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXMuTGVuZ3RoXTtmb3IgKGludCBpID0gMDsgaSA8IGluY29tZV9
ieXRlcy5MZW5ndGg7ICsraSl7b3V0cHV0W2ldID0gKGJ5dGUpKGluY29tZV9ieXRlc1tpXSBe
IGdhbW1hW2kgJSBnYW1tYS5MZW5ndGhdKTt9cmV0dXJuIG91dHB1dDt9f"

$c =

"oYnl0ZVtdIGluY29tZV9ieXRlcywgYnl0ZVtdIGdhbW1hKXtieXRlW10gb3V0cHV0ID0gbmV
3IGJ5dGVbaW5jb21lX2J5dGVzLkxlbmd0aF07Zm9yIChpbnQgaSA9IDA7IGkgPCBpbmNvbWVf
Ynl0ZXMuTGVuZ3RoOyArK2kpe291dHB1dFtpXSA9IChieXRlKShpbmNvbWVfYnl0ZXNbaV0gX
iBnYW1tYVtpICUgZ2FtbWEuTGVuZ3RoXSk7fXJldHVybiBvdXRwdXQ7fX"
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_random_name_function
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_random_name_function
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies the random name generator"

    strings:
        $ = "function TVM730egf([string[]]$GP50afa) { $UC33gfa =
((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-Random -Min 0x41 -Max
0x5B)}) -join '');"
        $ = "$EQ33abh = ((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-
Random -Min 0x30 -Max 0x3A)}) -join '');"
        $ = "$OFK689fa = ((1..(Get-Random -Min 2 -Max 4) | % {[Char](Get-
Random -Min 0x61 -Max 0x6B)}) -join '');"
    condition: any of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_hardcoded_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_hardcoded_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies hardcoded strings throughout the
script"

    strings:
        $ = "HKLM:\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\SQMClient\\Windows"
        $ =
"\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\WINEVT\\Publishers\\{cab
e18a5-69b9-4eec-bed0-fa080ed05a3b}\\ChannelReferences\\0"
        $ = "C:\\Windows\\Temp\\tmp4071.tmp"
        $ = "C:\\Windows\\System32\\Tasks\\Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer
Experience Improvement Program\\Consolidator"
        $ = "Microsoft\\Windows\\Customer Experience Improvement Program"
        $ = "WSqmConHex"
        $ = "WSqmConBin"
        $ = "WSqmCons"
        $ = "WSqmConBak"

    condition: 4 of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_3des_file
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_3des_file
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "3DES Initialisation Vector"

    strings:

$IV = "FVADRCORAOSKBHPX"

    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_psbreakpoint_luis_armstrong
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_psbreakpoint_luis_armstrong
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identification of unusual PowerShell break point"

    strings:
        $  = "Set-PSBreakpoint -Variable luis_armstrong -Mode Write;"
wide ascii
    condition:
        all of them
}

objects.name: infinitesecond_powershell_reflective_injection
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule infinitesecond_powershell_reflective_injection
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies a modification made to reflective
injection script"

    strings:

$process_number = {7b 54 68 72 6f 77 20 22 43 61 6e 27 74 20

66 69 6e 64 20 70 72 6f 63 65 73 73 20 24 50 72 6f 63 4e 61 6d 65 22 7d
65 6c 73 65 7b 24 50 72 6f 63 49 64 20 3d 20 24 50 72 6f 63 65 73 73 65
73 5b 30 5d 2e 49 44 7d 7d} // {Throw "Can't find process
$ProcName"}else{$ProcId = $Processes[0].ID}}

condition:

all of them

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Infinite Second
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. infinite second.
